items.title: A list of fundraising startups from Asia and beyond (Updated)
SoftBank invests $50m in bitcoin miner for AI expansion
items.summary:
- Cipher Mining received a $50 million investment from SoftBank, acquiring about 10.4 million shares.
- The investment will support Cipher's expansion into high-performance computing and AI data center hosting.
- Cipher is the tenth-largest public bitcoin miner with a market valuation of $1.6 billion.
- The company aims to reduce exposure to cryptocurrency market volatility while addressing AI solution demand.
- Cipher is developing a 300 MW Barber Lake site in Texas and has a one-month exclusivity agreement with SoftBank.
- JPMorgan observers noted this investment as part of a trend for mining companies to explore AI-driven infrastructure.

items.title: Ola Electric shares rise after Gen 3 scooter launch
Barbie joins digital learning app for interactive education
items.summary:
- Barbie brand will be integrated into Kiddopia, a digital learning app, later this year.
- The app will feature Barbie-themed educational games.
- The partnership aims to combine education with entertainment to create interactive learning experiences.
- Kiddopia, founded in 2012, operates primarily in the US and focuses on theme-based learning.
- In December 2024, Kiddopia partnered with Moonbug Entertainment to add the 'Little Angel' property.
- Nazara Technologies acquired Paper Boat Apps for 300 crore rupees (approximately US$34.60 million) in 2024.
- Nazara Technologies is expanding its gaming and digital entertainment presence and raised 495 crore rupees (US$57.1 million) to support growth.

items.title: Apple AI expands to 8 more languages in 2025
items.author: Tim Cook
items.summary:
- Apple’s AI platform, Apple Intelligence, will support eight additional languages starting in April 2025: French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, Japanese, Korean, and simplified Chinese.
- The announcement was made during CEO Tim Cook's Q4 2024 earnings call on January 30.
- This expansion follows the initial 2024 release, which supported only US English.
- In December 2024, localized English variants were added for Australia, Canada, New Zealand, South Africa, and the UK, along with tailored versions for India and Singapore.
- No plans have been announced to expand Apple Intelligence to the European Union or Mainland China.
- An updated version of Siri is also in the works to improve context understanding, expected in the coming months.

items.title: Japan plans to expand export controls on chips, quantum tech
items.summary:
- Japan is expanding export controls to include advanced semiconductor chips and quantum computing technology.
- Proposed changes require companies to obtain licenses for exporting advanced chips, lithography equipment, and quantum cryocoolers.
- The government aims to prevent use of these technologies in weapons development and advanced encryption-breaking systems.
- New restrictions will take effect at the end of May 2025.
- Japan will add 42 new entities to its export oversight list, totaling around 110 Chinese companies and institutions.
- China has criticized these measures, warning of potential disruptions to supply chain security and economic relations.
- This action aligns with the U.S. tightening restrictions on chip sales for AI applications amid concerns over re-exportation to China.

items.title: UK AI Minister warns of risks with DeepSeek chatbot
items.author: Feryal Clark
items.summary:
- UK AI Minister Feryal Clark advises caution for users of the DeepSeek chatbot, highlighting data usage understanding.
- DeepSeek, a low-cost alternative to US models, is currently popular on Apple's iPhone app store in the UK.
- The UK government is monitoring DeepSeek's developments and is creating a voluntary code of practice to address cybersecurity risks.
- A forthcoming cybersecurity bill aims to fortify defenses against vulnerabilities in the tech landscape.
- Recent reports indicate DeepSeek's performance concerns, including toxic output and biased content, with key developments ongoing in the sector.

items.title: LinkedIn lawsuit over AI training dismissed
items.summary:
- A lawsuit against LinkedIn regarding the use of private messages for AI training has been dismissed.  
- The lawsuit was filed by Alessandro De La Torre but was voluntarily withdrawn on Jan. 30.  
- Evidence presented indicated that LinkedIn did not use private messages for AI training.  
- LinkedIn's legal counsel confirmed the company does not utilize customer private messages for AI purposes.  
- The case is closed without prejudice, allowing for potential future legal actions.

items.title: Switch 2, Mario Kart may boost Nintendo’s stock outlook
items.summary:
• Nintendo is launching its next-generation console, the Switch 2, which is expected to enhance its stock market performance.
• The company's shares have risen by 25% over the past year, outperforming Japan’s Topix index.
• Nintendo's market capitalization has surpassed US$87 billion, aided by successful content strategies and expansion into movies and theme parks.
• Analyst Junko Yamamura predicts earnings recovery starting in fiscal year 2025 with new software titles and the Switch 2 amid declining demand for the original Switch.
• There is investor optimism regarding potential new titles such as Mario Kart 9 and a Legend of Zelda movie.
• Analysts warn about risks including challenges in hardware and tariffs affecting the US market.

items.title: Japan PM to meet OpenAI, SoftBank CEOs over $500b AI plan
items.author: Shigeru Ishiba, Sam Altman, Masayoshi Son
items.summary:
- Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba will meet with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and SoftBank Group CEO Masayoshi Son on Feb. 3.
- This meeting follows the announcement by US President Donald Trump about a joint venture involving OpenAI, SoftBank, and Oracle.
- The partnership aims to invest up to US$500 billion in developing infrastructure for artificial intelligence.
- Details of the agenda have not been disclosed.

items.title: Taiwan bans government use of DeepSeek over security risks
items.summary:
- Taiwan’s Ministry of Digital Affairs has banned government departments from using DeepSeek AI services due to security risks.
- Concerns arose over cross-border data transmission that could lead to information leaks.
- DeepSeek is categorized as a potential threat to national information security amid geopolitical tensions with Beijing.
- Other countries like South Korea, France, Italy, and Ireland are also reviewing DeepSeek’s data handling practices.
- DeepSeek’s AI assistant has recently surpassed ChatGPT in App Store downloads.

items.title: The top lenders to SEA’s and India’s tech companies
items.summary:
- The article provides a visual overview of the leading lenders to tech companies in Southeast Asia and India.
- It highlights the most active financial institutions that have invested in the region's technology sector.
- Key trends and data points regarding funding patterns and lender profiles are discussed.

items.title: DeepSeek-R1 produces ‘toxic output, biased content’: report
items.summary:
- DeepSeek-R1 is 11 times more likely to generate harmful content than OpenAI’s O1 model.
- The model produces toxic output, biased content, and insecure code, including information on chemical and biological threats.
- Reports show it generates discriminatory content, harmful extremist material, and insecure code such as malware and hacking tools.

items.title: AI output requires human touch for copyright: US gov’t
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- US government emphasizes that AI-generated outputs need human attribution for copyright protection.
- The notice highlights potential legal implications for businesses using AI technology.
- The guidelines aim to clarify copyright ownership regarding AI-generated content and ensure compliance.

items.title: Google unveils Gemini 2.0 Pro Experimental AI model
items.summary:
- Google has released the Gemini 2.0 Pro Experimental AI model in its chatbot app.
- The model is available to Gemini Advanced users starting January 30, 2024.
- It is the successor to Gemini 1.5 Pro, which launched in February 2024.
- The model aims to improve performance in coding and mathematics tasks.
- It is still in an 'early preview' phase and may exhibit unpredictable behavior.
- The model lacks real-time information access and compatibility with some Gemini app features.
- Gemini Advanced, which includes this model, is part of Google’s AI Premium paid plan.

items.title: South Korea investigates DeepSeek over personal data
items.summary:
- South Korea’s Personal Information Protection Commission (PIPC) is investigating DeepSeek's management of user personal data.
- A written request for information will be sent to DeepSeek’s operators on Jan. 31.
- Regulatory authorities in France, Italy, and Ireland are also investigating DeepSeek's data practices.

items.title: Samsung warns of declining AI chip sales from US limits
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics anticipates a decline in AI chip sales in Q1 2025 due to US export restrictions on China.
- The restrictions, implemented in December, affect around 20% of Samsung's high-bandwidth memory (HBM) chip sales.
- The company faces high demand from clients like Nvidia but struggles with GPU chip supply constraints, delaying customer projects.
- Samsung reported a 29% decline in operating profit for Q4 2024, at 6.5 trillion won (U$4.48 billion).
- Weak earnings growth is expected in Q1 2025 due to low demand for memory chips and other devices.
- A recovery in memory market demand is anticipated starting in Q2 2025.

items.title: Teen self-care brand Sammmm raises $1.15m seed funding
items.author: Mantosh Roy, Rishi Seth
items.summary:
- Teen self-care brand Sammmm raised ₹10 crore (US$1.15 million) in seed funding.
- Funding led by Fireside Ventures, with participation from Sauce VC and several angel investors.
- Founded in February 2024 by former Nykaa leaders Mantosh Roy and Rishi Seth.
- Focus on producing beauty, wellness, and lifestyle products for teenagers, including moisturizers, cleansers, and lip tint oils.
- Funding to expand product offerings and enhance market presence and distribution channels.
- Aims to address the gap in the Indian market for personal care products designed for teenagers.

items.title: El Salvador makes bitcoin voluntary legal tender
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- El Salvador’s Congress approved amendments to its bitcoin law on January 29, 2023.
- Acceptance of bitcoin is now voluntary instead of mandatory.
- This reform was proposed by President Nayib Bukele to meet IMF requirements for a $1.4 billion loan.
- The amendment passed with 55 votes in favor and 2 against, largely backed by Bukele’s New Ideas Party.
- This change reverses the 2021 designation of bitcoin as legal tender alongside the US dollar.

items.title: Apple sees modest growth amid iPhone sales decline
items.summary:
- Apple projects modest sales growth for the fiscal quarter despite a decline in iPhone sales.
- Reported US$124.3 billion in Q1 revenue, slightly surpassing estimates.
- iPhone revenue dropped to US$69.14 billion due to competition and slow AI feature rollout.
- Sales of Mac and iPad reached US$8.99 billion and US$8.09 billion, respectively, offsetting iPhone declines.
- Services segment grew 13.9% to US$26.34 billion, exceeding forecasts.
- CEO Tim Cook noted that AI features are boosting sales, but delays exist in key markets like China.

items.title: US VC firm 8VC seeks $1b for sixth fund
items.author: Joe Lonsdale
items.summary:
- Austin-based venture capital firm 8VC aims to raise nearly US$1 billion for its sixth fund.
- This target is a 14% increase from its previous fund of US$880 million, closed in February 2023.
- Founded in 2015, 8VC has invested in over 600 companies, including Asana, Flexport, and The Boring Company.
- 8VC is noted for investments in defense technology, including Saronic and Overland AI.
- The firm emphasizes health technology and life sciences, with over a quarter of its investments in biotech firms like Senti Bio and Vir.

items.title: SK hynix stock drops 11% after DeepSeek AI launch
items.summary:
- SK hynix's stock fell over 11% after the Lunar New Year holiday.
- The decline followed the launch of DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup's new advanced AI model.
- SK hynix's stock is still up 15% in 2024, contributing to the recovery of the Kospi index.

items.title: German crypto startup Irreducible raises $24m series A
items.summary:
- German crypto startup Irreducible raised $24 million in series A funding, co-led by Paradigm and Bain Capital Crypto.
- Other investors include Fenbushi Capital, L2 Iterative Ventures, and Robot Ventures.
- Founded in 2022, Irreducible focuses on zero-knowledge proof (ZKP) generation infrastructure to improve efficiency.
- The startup has developed a ZKP system called Binius, enhancing efficiency with binary field towers instead of traditional prime fields.
- Irreducible manages proof generation in its own data centers, unlike competitors using cloud computing.
- The company currently employs 25 people and plans to double its engineering team within two to three years.

items.title: Czech central bank approves proposal for bitcoin reserves
items.summary:
- The Czech central bank has approved a proposal to hold bitcoin as part of its reserves.
- This decision marks a significant shift in the bank's approach to digital currencies.
- The central bank aims to explore the potential of cryptocurrencies alongside traditional assets.

items.title: US probes whether DeepSeek acquires Nvidia chips from SG: source
items.summary:
- US officials are investigating DeepSeek, a Chinese AI company, over potential acquisition of Nvidia chips via Singapore intermediaries.
- The investigation targets circumvention of US restrictions on chip sales for AI tasks.
- DeepSeek's chatbot models, R1 and V3, allegedly used Nvidia's restricted H800 chips. 
- Nvidia mandates compliance with relevant laws from all customers.
- Revenue from Singapore does not confirm diversion to China as chips may be sent to other regions; Singapore accounts for 20% of Nvidia's revenue.
- The FBI and White House are involved in the investigation, with no response from DeepSeek. 
- This issue underscores ongoing US-China tensions concerning semiconductor restrictions.

items.title: Samsung and SK Hynix Concern Over US Subsidy Review
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics and SK hynix express concerns about US investments due to comments from Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick.
- Lutnick suggested a review of subsidies under the CHIPS Act that benefit global chipmakers, including both companies.
- Samsung has received US$4.74 billion for a US$37 billion project in Texas, while SK hynix secured US$485 million for its Indiana plant.
- Potential subsidy cuts may impact customer acquisition for their US operations.
- US dependence on high bandwidth memory chips from these firms for AI applications is highlighted by semiconductor expert Lee Jong-hwan.

items.title: Software firm Monday.com expands office, grows globally
items.summary:
- Monday.com is expanding its office to support global growth initiatives.
- The company aims to enhance its operations and services worldwide.
- This move is part of a broader strategy to solidify its market presence and meet increasing demand.

items.title: Swiss tech giant ABB sees growth despite DeepSeek’s rise
items.summary:
- ABB anticipates ongoing demand for electrification products from data centers despite the rise of lower-energy AI models like DeepSeek.
- DeepSeek's emergence led to a tech stock selloff, but ABB CEO Morten Wierod confirmed that major customers are maintaining their capital expenditure plans.
- The data center market is expected to grow nearly 12% annually, reaching US$685 billion by 2032, which will benefit ABB’s business.
- Orders for ABB's data center-related products increased by 23% annually from 2019-2023, projected to accelerate to 15% of its electrification segment in 2024.

items.title: Israeli cybersecurity firm files for insolvency over debt
items.summary:
- GuardKnox, an Israeli automotive cybersecurity firm, filed for insolvency due to debts of 11 million shekels (approximately US$3.06 million).
- The company, founded in 2016, focused on cybersecurity for smart and autonomous vehicles.
- Financial issues intensified during the COVID-19 pandemic, and a recent war caused investors to back out of a US$30 million funding deal.
- GuardKnox owes 4 million shekels (US$1.1 million) to a transport firm and 3 million shekels (US$833,000) in unpaid salaries to its 27 employees.
- The firm reduced employee salaries to 80% and cut its workforce from 80 to 27 members.
- A recovery plan has been proposed to restructure finances and maintain minimal operations, pending court approval.

items.title: Global chipmaker STMicroelectronics sees Q1 revenue drop
items.summary:
- STMicroelectronics reported a drop in revenue for Q1.
- The decline in revenue reflects ongoing challenges in the semiconductor industry.
- Market reactions indicate concerns over future earnings and demand.

items.title: Meta says US fact-check end doesn’t impact ads revenue
items.summary:
- Meta reported that the end of its US fact-checking program has not adversely affected its advertising revenue.
- The company expressed confidence in its advertising strategies despite regulatory changes.
- Analysts had speculated that the discontinuation of the program could lead to challenges for Meta's ad model.

items.title: Fintech firm Cushion shuts down due to growth challenges
items.summary:
- Fintech firm Cushion has shut down operations due to significant growth challenges.
- The company faced difficulties scaling its services effectively.
- This closure highlights ongoing struggles within the fintech sector for some startups.

items.title: Toyota, Daihatsu, Suzuki to launch joint mini EV vans
items.summary:
- On Jan. 30, Daihatsu, Toyota, and Suzuki announced plans to launch mini-commercial EVs in fiscal 2025.
- The project faced delays due to falsified safety tests by Daihatsu, but development resumed after corrective actions.
- The new vehicles will leverage Daihatsu and Suzuki’s small-vehicle production expertise and Toyota’s EV technology.
- Production will occur at Daihatsu facilities, and the mini-vans will be marketed under each brand.
- Demand for mini EV vans is increasing in Japan as trucking companies electrify, with competitors like Mitsubishi Motors and Honda already involved.

items.title: Voice AI startup ElevenLabs nets $180m series C
French fintech startup Swan raises $44m series B
items.author: Nicolas Benady
items.summary:
- Swan raised €42 million (US$44 million) in series B funding.
- The funding round was led by Eight Roads Ventures with participation from existing investors like Lakestar, Accel, Creandum, Hexa, and Bpifrance.
- Swan provides embedded financial services for businesses, including payment accounts and card issuing.
- The startup processes €1.5 billion (US$1.56 billion) in transactions monthly and has 150 clients.
- The funding will be used for international expansion, starting with Italy.

items.title: Samsung’s Q4 profit misses estimates
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics reported an operating profit of 2.9 trillion won (US$2.1 billion) for Q4, missing estimates.
- The net income for the quarter was 7.58 trillion won (US$5.26 billion), attributed to its network business.
- Stock declined by 2.5% on Jan. 31 due to concerns over challenges in AI-specific memory chips.
- Recent developments include the delayed launch of smart glasses and the introduction of the Galaxy S25 series with AI enhancements.

items.title: Israeli tech firm cuts 2025 forecast due to China struggles
items.summary:
- An Israeli tech firm has revised its financial forecast for 2025 downwards due to challenges faced in the Chinese market.
- The company cites increased competition and regulatory hurdles as major factors contributing to its decision.
- This adjustment may impact investors and stakeholders relying on projected growth in the region.

items.title: Intel receives $2.2b funding from CHIPS Act
items.summary:
- Intel announced it received $2.2 billion in federal grants through the US CHIPS and Science Act.
- Funding provided in two payments: $1.1 billion at the end of 2024 and $1.1 billion in January 2025.
- An additional $5.66 billion in funding remains to be released, contributing to a total of $7.86 billion under the CHIPS Act, lower than the estimated $8.5 billion.
- Funds will improve semiconductor manufacturing and packaging at sites in Arizona, New Mexico, Ohio, and Oregon, focusing on integrating multiple chips into single packages.

items.title: Zepto rolls out 10-minute exchange, returns service
items.summary:
- Zepto launches a 10-minute exchange and return service for select product categories.
- Exclusions include innerwear, gold and silver coins, disposable items, and utility products due to safety and regulatory reasons.
- Customers can inspect orders upon delivery and initiate exchanges or returns using the platform.
- Refunds are immediate post-validation but may take longer to reflect in bank accounts.
- For cash-on-delivery orders, refunds are processed as coupons or vouchers.

items.title: Indian drone tech firm secretary resigns amid merger talks
items.summary:
- Harshal J. Kher resigns as company secretary at DroneAcharya effective January 31.
- Resignation attributed to pursuit of professional growth and development.
- Departure follows news of a potential merger with AITMC Ventures.
- Despite the merger, both firms will retain their brand identities and integrate support teams.
- DroneAcharya, founded in 2017 by Prateek Srivastava, offers services like drone pilot training and data processing.
- Recently announced a collaboration with Volatus Aerospace for drone manufacturing in India in December 2024.

items.title: India’s Prudent launches $57.8m fund for early-stage startups
items.author: Prashasta Seth
items.summary:
- Prudent Investment Managers has launched a fund worth 500 crore rupees (approximately $57.8 million) for early-stage startups.
- The fund has secured 250 crore rupees ($28.9 million) in commitments from family offices and is expected to close by June 2025.
- Prudent is applying for a license as a Category II AIF from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI).
- The firm has invested approximately 160 crore rupees ($18.48 million) in unlisted companies, including startups like The Money Club and Snapmint.
- The focus is on pre-series A and series A startups with sustainable business models and strong unit economics.
keywords: Securities and Exchange Board of India

items.title: Pentagon bans DeepSeek due to security concerns
items.summary:
- The U.S. Defense Department has restricted access to the Chinese AI chatbot DeepSeek due to security concerns.
- The block was initiated by the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) on January 27.
- DeepSeek's privacy policy states that user data is stored on Chinese servers and subject to Chinese law, prompting action from defense officials.
- On January 29, some Pentagon screens displayed a 'Website Blocked' message, while others still had access to the platform.

items.title: India to host DeepSeek models on local servers
items.summary:
- Ashwini Vaishnaw, India’s IT minister, announced plans to host Chinese AI lab DeepSeek’s large language models on domestic servers.
- This decision addresses data privacy concerns and is significant as it allows Chinese technology in India despite strict data localization policies.
- DeepSeek’s models will be supported by India’s upcoming AI Compute Facility.
- India has banned over 300 Chinese apps since 2020 due to security concerns.
- Vaishnaw emphasized fostering indigenous AI innovation while hosting foreign models.
- The country is investing in hyperscale infrastructure and collaborating with global chip designers to strengthen its AI ecosystem.
- India is also developing a regulatory body for AI safety and funding AI applications in sectors like agriculture and climate change.

items.title: Meta settles lawsuit with Trump for $25m: sources
items.summary:
- Meta Platforms has reached a US$25 million settlement involving former President Donald Trump.
- The settlement allocates US$22 million for Trump's presidential library and the remainder for legal fees and individual plaintiffs.
- This agreement follows a two-year suspension of Trump’s Facebook and Instagram accounts due to the January 6 Capitol riot, with reinstatement occurring in 2023 under new guidelines.
- Neither Meta nor Trump’s legal teams have commented on the settlement details.
- CEO Mark Zuckerberg's past interactions with Trump are under scrutiny post-settlement.

items.title: China’s CXMT advances 16nm DRAM, closing gap with Samsung
items.summary:
- ChangXin Memory Technologies (CXMT) has manufactured 16-nanometre DRAM technology.
- This advancement aims to close the technology gap with leaders like Samsung Electronics, SK Hynix, and Micron Technology.
- CXMT produced a 16-gigabit DRAM chip using DDR5 technology, expected to dominate the market until at least 2027.
- The chip has a size of 67 square millimeters and a storage density of 0.239 Gb per square millimeter.
- The new G4 DRAM features memory cells 20% smaller than the previous G3 generation.
- CXMT has progressed from previous nodes: G1 at 23nm and G2 at 18nm.

items.title: Indian footwear startup nets $2.5m to boost production
items.author: Sankar Bora, Deepan Babu, Bharat Mahajan, Deepak Patil
items.summary:
- CHK, a footwear startup, raised $2.5 million in seed funding led by Accel.
- Previous pre-seed investment from BlueStone Jewellery and Lifestyle Ltd.
- Funds will enhance production capacity and support a go-to-market strategy for a planned launch in April.
- A new in-house design and production facility in Tamil Nadu will begin operations within two weeks.
- CHK was founded in September 2024 and targets lifestyle footwear for millennial and Gen-Z consumers in India.

items.title: SK Telecom’s AI assistant to link with major apps: sources
items.summary:
- SK Telecom is launching an AI assistant named Aster that will connect with applications like Google Calendar.
- Aster will allow users to manage schedules, create to-do lists, and plan transportation independently.
- The beta service is set to launch in North America in March 2025, with a full rollout planned for the second half of 2025.
- SK Telecom is exploring further integrations with apps such as Yelp, Uber, and Lyft, with features subject to customer feedback during the beta phase.

items.title: Indian B2B unicorn OfBusiness rebrands, aims for IPO in 2025
items.summary:
- OfBusiness has rebranded as OFB Tech Limited and aims for an IPO in late 2025.
- The company targets a valuation of US$6 billion to US$9 billion and plans to raise US$750 million to US$1 billion.
- It will raise US$200 million from new stock issuance, with the remainder from an offer for sale.
- Founded in 2016, OfBusiness serves SMEs in manufacturing and infrastructure with procurement and financing services.
- The company secured US$878 million in total funding, last raising US$325 million in 2021 at a US$5 billion valuation.
- OfBusiness reports a 30% net profit growth for FY 2023-24 and has appointed banks including Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan to manage the IPO.

items.title: OpenAI employee quits, calls AI race a ‘risky gamble’
items.author: Steven Adler
items.summary:
- Steven Adler, an AI researcher and safety officer at OpenAI, resigned due to concerns about the rapid pace of AI development.
- He worked at OpenAI since March 2022, eight months before the launch of ChatGPT, and is worried about artificial general intelligence (AGI) potentially exceeding human intelligence.
- Adler warned that the global race to achieve AGI is a 'very risky gamble' and that the urgency could compromise vital safety measures.
- He emphasized the difficulties in ensuring AI systems' goals align with human values, highlighting the challenges of AI alignment.
- Despite assurances from OpenAI CEO Sam Altman that AGI should benefit humanity, Adler hopes AI labs will adopt stronger safety regulations.
- He pointed out the increasing competition with the launch of DeepSeek by a Chinese startup and stressed the need for collaboration to mitigate AI risks.

items.title: Why Indian EV players are charging into the SEA opportunity
items.summary:
- Indian electric vehicle (EV) manufacturers are expanding into Southeast Asia (SEA).
- This shift is driven by increasing demand for EVs in the region and supportive government policies.
- Companies are exploring partnerships and investments to capitalize on opportunities in markets like Indonesia and Thailand.
